Package daniel.nofulla.homework2

Interface ADTHeap<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Heap
    public interface ADTHeap<T>
    This is the generic ADTHeap Interface
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Daniel Nofulla

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      T delete()
      The delete method deletes the root (biggest) element from the heap and returns the element deleted.
      void heapify​(int i)
      Heapify recursively loops to adjust the array in the correct order by swapping elements between parent nodes (current index) and child nodes (left and right child positions)
      void insert​(T item)
      The insert operation first builds the max heap in order to make the insertion process flawless.
      boolean isEmpty()
      The isEmpty method checks if the heap is empty
      void sort()
      The sort method performs the heapsort operation on a max heap using max heapify to set the items in the heap in sorted order (smallest to biggest)

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        void insert​(T item)
     throws HeapException
        The insert operation first builds the max heap in order to make the insertion process flawless. After building the max heap, we increase the heap's size by 1, add it to the heap's list, and increase the key of that item so that the heap is adjusted accordingly.
        Parameters:
        item - The reference to a generic item
        Throws:
        HeapException - Throws the HeapException

      • delete

        T delete()
  throws HeapException
        The delete method deletes the root (biggest) element from the heap and returns the element deleted. We first build the max heap to ensure a flawless deletion.
        Returns:
        Returns the item deleted (the root of the heap)
        Throws:
        HeapException - Throws the HeapException

      • heapify

        void heapify​(int i)
        Heapify recursively loops to adjust the array in the correct order by swapping elements between parent nodes (current index) and child nodes (left and right child positions)
        Parameters:
        i - Reference to the current index

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        The isEmpty method checks if the heap is empty
        Returns:
        Returns true if the heapSize is 0

      • sort

        void sort()
        The sort method performs the heapsort operation on a max heap using max heapify to set the items in the heap in sorted order (smallest to biggest)
